result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis W Hyland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with the parties listed in the criminal complaint. 
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: FIRST 60 days are Straight Time and LAST 30 days with Huber. ALL STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Mastantuono makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: parties listed in criminal complaint
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

FINE:  $1,355.50  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   90 Days jail,  1st 60 Days straight time and last 30 Days with huber - ALL STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion)


COUNT #2:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER     **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: parties listed in criminal complaint
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:    IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER     **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNTS #1 & 2**

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: parties listed in criminal complaint
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Dated 01/27/16, from Atty Mastantuono to Judge Carter, character letter attached.
Sentencing hearing at 01-29-2016 11:00 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1-3 on amended information filed today.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1-3 on amended information.  Attorney Mastantuono requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-26-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 01-21-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mastantuono requests another adjournment for negotiations to continue. Court will set for jury trial. Parties may request an earlier plea and sentencing date if case gets resolved. Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-14-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mastantuono requests a plea and sentecing date within about 3 weeks. Court grants. Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  District Attorney Susan Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mastantuono request to remove Motion hearing and set for a further proceeding date for further negotiations with the State. The State agrees. Motion is held in abeyance.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mastantuono files motion to suppress. Court schedules motion hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Detective Koeppel sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Opper.  Cross examination by Attorney Mastantuono.  Exhibits #1-3 marked and not moved into evidence.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any co-actors, victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Travis W Hyland in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
